definition: to bare one shoulder/(fig.) to side with/to discriminate in favor of
to lean/to slant/oblique/prejudiced/to deviate from average/to stray from the intended line/stubbornly/contrary to expectations

sentences.english: The leadership issued a statement denying any favoritism.
sentences.chinese: 公約領導層發表一份聲明表示否認有任何偏袒。

sentences.english: The law does not discriminate against the poor in favour of the rich.
sentences.chinese: 法律絕不歧視窮人而偏袒富人。

sentences.english: Every office has its share of favoritism, inefficiency and dumb decisions.
sentences.chinese: 每一個辦公室都有偏袒，低效，錯誤決定的現象。

sentences.english: That teacher discriminates in favour of girls.
Mr Thompson is Nitze’s grandson. But he does not play favourites.
sentences.chinese: 雖然湯普森是尼采的孫子，可他並不偏袒湯普森。

sentences.english: The Methods: They employed were heavily biased in the gentry's favour.
sentences.chinese: 他們採用的方法嚴重偏袒中上階級。

sentences.english: Railway ballast will be loaded onto ballast trains at an established ballast siding.
sentences.chinese: 鐵路道碴，將載入碴列車在一個既定的鎮流器偏袒。

sentences.english: I think your choice of a successor savors of favoritism.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲你對繼承人的選擇有偏袒之嫌。

sentences.english: Judges ought not to consider anything on the person.
Recognize your own biases and keep them in check.
sentences.chinese: 認清你自己的偏袒處來中立化你的言論。

sentences.english: I am not taking sides in this controversy.
sentences.chinese: 我並沒有在這場爭論中偏袒任何一方。

sentences.english: That doesn't seem like a pro-Microsoft search result.
sentences.chinese: 所以，這個搜索結果似乎並不偏袒微軟吧。

sentences.english: Fair play and no favours-and may the best man win .
sentences.chinese: 公正而不偏袒讓最優秀的人贏得勝利。

sentences.english: Her good name was disfigured by instances of favouritism.
sentences.chinese: 她的好名聲因其偏袒行爲而被損害了。

sentences.english: Louise got a bum rap for taking sides with Richard.
sentences.chinese: 露易斯因爲偏袒裏查德而遭責罵。

definition: to shield (a miscreant) from punishment, criticism etc/to take sb's side
to protect a croney/to give unprincipled support
to defend sb (a relative, friend or oneself) despite knowing that that person is in the wrong
to favour one and discriminate against the other
lit. to hold a bowl of water level (idiom)/fig. to be impartial
to try to smooth things over/to paper over the issues/to gloss things over
to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
(of a woman) to be fiercely protective of one's children
